util package¶

Submodules¶

util.load_prov module¶

Helper function to load content of paragraphs.

util.load_prov.load_prov(name)¶

Loads the contents of a paragraph by name.

Parameters:name – The name of the paragraph.
Raises:FileNotFoundError – If no such file can be found.
Returns:The content of that paragraph.

util.paths module¶

All the paths used by the system to write various files to. Recommended to use absolute paths for everything, but not required.

  • MAIN_FOLDER: Useful to have the folders relative to this main path but not needed with absolute paths.
  • TEXT_PATH: Path to where the texts are placed
  • TEXT_META_PATH: Path to where metainformation about the text files is being stored
  • PARAGRAPHS_PATH: Path to the toplevel directory for paragraph contents
  • PARAGRAPH_CONTENT_PATH: Path to the directory where the contents of the paragraphs (the text) are being stored
  • POS_PATH: Path to where the POS tagged text / sentence chunks are
  • CLOSENESS_PATH: Path to where the files with the information about the weighted distances are
  • MEMSTORE_PATH: Path to where the memstore is stored
  • RELATION_WEIGHT_PATH: Path to where the shortform relations are stored
  • RELATIONS_PATH: Path to where the mapping of token: relations is being stored
  • RELATION_PROVENANCES_PATH: Path to where the SPOP tuples are stored
